key_risks: Patent infringement lawsuit with potential financial liabilities and reputational damage
Data security concerns due to past breaches and vulnerabilities
Customer support issues affecting retention and satisfaction
Pricing model criticism, particularly for small businesses and startups
controversies: Ongoing patent infringement lawsuit from Michael Kaufman
Security incidents, including the Codecov breach
social_issues: Customer dissatisfaction with support and pricing, particularly among smaller businesses
governance_issues: Potential governance challenges related to handling legal disputes and security vulnerabilities

sources.title: Inventor Who Beat Microsoft Now Battling Monday.com Over Patents
sources.snippet: A New York-based inventor who won a $10 million patent-infringement verdict in 2022 against Microsoft Corp. is now suing Israeli software company Monday.com Ltd. over the same invention at the heart of the Microsoft case.. sources.title: monday.com and GDPR - Support
sources.snippet: Since May 25, 2018 (and even beforehand) monday.com has been complying with the GDPR. For those who are not familiar with it, the GDPR is the biggest change in data protection laws in Europe since the 1995 introduction of the European Union (EU) Data Protection Directive. The GDPR aims to strengthen the security and protection of personal data in the EU.

sources.title: Part 1: Data breaches and the Australian Privacy Act | OAIC
sources.snippet: An entity can reduce the reputational impact of a data breach by effectively minimising the risk of harm to affected individuals, and by demonstrating accountability in their data breach response. This involves being transparent when a data breach, which is likely to cause serious harm to affected individuals, occurs.
